 From your description, it sounds like you can likely just use  
SuiteRunner's built-in print reporter, which prints results out as they  
are reported. You can configure it to print everything, just failures,  
whatever you want. This article gives step by step instructions on  
using SuiteRunner as your JUnit runner:

http://www.artima.com/suiterunner/junit.html

If the build-in print reporter doesn't satisfy your needs, you can  
create a custom reporter that does whatever you want with the test  
results.  For example, this article explains how to build a custom  
reporter that prints results in XML:

http://www.artima.com/suiterunner/xmlreporter.html

Bill

On Monday, March 10, 2003, at 08:01 PM, Jason Rogers wrote:

> On Mon, 2003-03-10 at 00:33, temp_id_649 wrote: I am trying to make a  
> UI
> similar to textui, but I want to have all
> the test cases output in order of execution.  Is there anyway to do
> this with the existing framework.  In textui as it stands nothing is
> output for a pased test (other than ".") and then the failures and
> errors are each listed seperately.  I want to have each test's result
> listed as the tests are executed.
>
> ie.  you could have a test passed then a failed test and then another
> passed test outputed in this order.
>
> I hope that I haven't confused anyone with this roundabout question.
>
> M Lavery
>
> Two solutions:
>
> 1. Give the textui a different ResultPrinter, overrriding the  
> following:
>     public void addError(Test test, Throwable t)
>     public void addFailure(Test test, AssertionFailedError t)
>     public void endTest(Test test) // if you need to
>     public void startTest(Test test)
>
> 2. Add a TestListener -- in which case you will probably want to give
> the TestRunner another PrintStream so that the two types of printings
> don't get mixed in together if your new one goes to stdout, so you  
> might
> as well just do number 1.
>
> =jason
